drivers.title: Learn the system
drivers.description: Master the driver → milestone → action hierarchy to build meaningful, intentional systems for your life. This driver demonstrates how strategic intent (drivers) connects to temporal targets (milestones) and executable work (actions).

milestones.title: Understand the three core problems
milestones.description: The system addresses: (1) disconnection between daily actions and meaningful goals, (2) lack of deliberate planning and intentionality, (3) no system for reflection and continuous improvement.

actions.title: Review your first driver
actions.description: Drivers represent your 'why'—the strategic intent and purpose behind your work. They answer the question: what meaningful outcome am I pursuing?

actions.title: Explore this milestone
actions.description: Milestones are temporal targets linked to drivers—the 'when' that gives structure to your intent. They create accountability and progress markers.

actions.title: Complete this action
actions.description: Actions are executable work—the 'what' you actually do. Every action must link to a milestone (no orphan actions). This enforces meaning before execution.

milestones.title: Set up your first real driver
milestones.description: Replace these examples with your own strategic intent. What meaningful outcome do you want to pursue?

actions.title: Define your driver
actions.description: Create a driver that represents something meaningful to you. Remember: drivers are about purpose and strategic intent, not tasks.

actions.title: Add a milestone
actions.description: Create a milestone with a target date. Milestones provide temporal structure and accountability.

actions.title: Create supporting actions
actions.description: Add 2-3 actions that move you toward your milestone. Each action should be concrete and executable.

drivers.title: Build sustainable habits
drivers.description: Develop recurring actions that compound over time. This driver demonstrates how the system supports habit formation through recurrence patterns and daily planning.

milestones.title: Establish daily rhythms
milestones.description: Create consistency through recurring actions that align with your drivers. Habits work best when connected to meaningful purpose.

actions.title: Morning reflection
actions.description: Review your drivers and plan your day with intention. Ask: which actions move me toward meaningful outcomes?
actions.trigger: After waking up, before checking email

actions.title: Evening review
actions.description: Reflect on what you completed and why it mattered. This reinforces the connection between daily actions and strategic intent.

milestones.title: Practice weekly reflection
milestones.description: Weekly reviews help you maintain perspective and adjust course. They address the third core problem: lack of reflection and continuous improvement.

actions.title: Weekly driver review
actions.description: Review your active drivers. Are they still meaningful? Do they need adjustment? Strategic intent evolves—your system should too.
